title: Nanofilm Technologies International First Half 2025 Earnings: EPS: S$0.002 (vs S$0.006 loss in 1H 2024)
description: Nanofilm Technologies International ( SGX:MZH ) First Half 2025 Results Key Financial Results Revenue: S$107.2m (up 30...
content:
• Net income: S$1.61m (up from S$3.74m loss in 1H 2024).
• Profit margin: 1.5% (up from net loss in 1H 2024). The move to profitability was driven by higher revenue.
• EPS: S$0.002 (up from S$0.006 loss in 1H 2024).

We've found 21 US stocks that are forecast to pay a dividend yield of over 6% next year. See the full list for free.

All figures shown in the chart above are for the trailing 12 month (TTM) period

Looking ahead, revenue is forecast to grow 8.6% p.a. on average during the next 3 years, compared to a 10% growth forecast for the Chemicals industry in Asia.

Performance of the market in Singapore.

The company's share price is broadly unchanged from a week ago.

While earnings are important, another area to consider is the balance sheet. We've done some analysis and you can see our take on Nanofilm Technologies International's balance sheet.

Have feedback on this article? Concerned about the content? Get in touch with us directly. Alternatively, email editorial-team (at) simplywallst.com.

It does not constitute a recommendation to buy or sell any stock, and does not take account of your objectives, or your financial situation. We aim to bring you long-term focused analysis driven by fundamental data. Note that our analysis may not factor in the latest price-sensitive company announcements or qualitative material. Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned.

keywords.name: Nanofilm Technologies International First Half 2025 Earnings

summary: Nofilm Technologies International (Nano) Technologies International has reported an increase in its first half 2025 earnings to S$0.002 (S$1.61m), net income of S$3.74m and a profit margin of 1.5%. The company's profitability was driven by higher revenue. Looking ahead, revenue is expected to grow by 8.6% p.
shortSummary: Nanofilm Technologies International's First Half 2025 earnings report shows increased revenue growth driven by increased profits, but shares remain unchanged; Simply Wall St.

Nanofilm Technologies International Balance Sheet Health
Financial Health criteria checks 6/6
Nanofilm Technologies International has a total shareholder equity of SGD412.2M and total debt of SGD87.5M, which brings its debt-to-equity ratio to 21.2%. Its total assets and total liabilities are SGD615.1M and SGD202.9M respectively. Nanofilm Technologies International's EBIT is SGD15.2M making its interest coverage ratio 20.1. It has cash and short-term investments of SGD95.9M.

argos_summary: Nanofilm Technologies International has swung from a S$3.74 m loss in H1 2024 to a S$1.61 m profit, with a 1.5% margin and EPS of S$0.002, driven by higher revenue and a strong balance sheet (debt‑to‑equity 21.2%, interest coverage 20.1x). Forecasts project earnings growth of 17.7% and revenue growth of 8.6% per year, with a modest 4.8% return on equity in three years, while the company’s dividend has been adjusted to SGD 0.0033. Singapore’s market remains flat over the last week, with the utilities sector falling 16% but the overall market up 26% year‑to‑date; key contributors include telecom, energy, and financials. A list of 21 US stocks is highlighted as expected to yield over 6% next year, and the article notes that Singapore’s market valuation has risen to a P/E of 13.9x as of 15 Aug 2025.
